Welcome to a collection of prayers written for those who study, teach, and practice the craft of computing.

In the discipline of Computer Science, we encounter profound questions about logic, creation, beauty, and human flourishing. These prayers are offered as a resource for students and professors who wish to integrate their faith with their intellectual work.

Whether you’re starting a new semester, debugging stubborn code, wrestling with imposter syndrome, or preparing to teach a difficult concept, these prayers invite you to bring your whole self—mind, heart, and soul—before God.

Explore our collection of 

Sample Prayers, including:

A Prayer for the Beginning of a Semester - For professors and students as a new term begins

A Prayer Before Debugging - When the code will not run, and the error is hidden

A Prayer for the Student Facing Imposter Syndrome - When you feel you do not belong

A Prayer Before Teaching a Difficult Concept - For the professor preparing to explain what is hard

“The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of his hands.”
— Psalm 19:1

“For from him and through him and for him are all things. To him be the glory forever! Amen.”
— Romans 11:36

hierarchy.lvl3: A Complete Map of Moments for Prayer
A Complete Map of Moments for Prayer

records.content: This collection offers prayers for every season, struggle, and celebration in the life of computer science students and professors.

For Students
When concepts won’t click and confusion reigns
Understanding dawns and problems solved
Coding sessions, study groups, and office hours
Exams, grades, interviews, and evaluation
For Professors
Planning courses, lectures, and assignments
Teaching moments, student engagement, and live coding
Mentorship, difficult conversations, and guidance
Grading, feedback, and evaluation
Research, tenure, conferences, and balance
Group projects, pair programming, and teamwork
Departments, conferences, and scholarly fellowship
Advisor-advisee relationships
Starting projects, designing systems, and creative flow
Hunting bugs, reading errors, and finding solutions
Writing tests, passes and failures
Production, monitoring, and long-term care
Imposter syndrome, burnout, and exhaustion
Rejection, mistakes, and career setbacks
When code is misused and integrity is tested
Algorithmic bias, privacy, accessibility, and responsibility
Discerning your path and finding meaning
Humility, patience, perseverance, and grace
Data structures, algorithms, architecture, and theory
AI/ML, graphics, cybersecurity, HCI, and robotics
Discrete math, probability, linear algebra, and cryptography
Git, IDEs, terminals, servers, and infrastructure
Morning coffee, afternoon slumps, and closing your laptop
Monday beginnings, Wednesday humps, Friday endings
Fall energy, winter darkness, spring renewal, summer work
For professors caring for the whole person
For students grateful for mentorship
Friendship, competition, and mutual support
Bridging CS and non-CS worlds
